page.title: 03INTERVIEWING AN OLD RESIDENT
page.content: { Mrs. Betty Kimber}has lived in Bexhill for most of her life. She now lives in Ardath, a{retirement home, one of several in our block. She was born in{Sidley}before buses ran and remembers the first difficult route one made up Chantry Lane, Old Town.She was a teacher before she got married. You could not be both in the 1920's in the state system. However, she later ran a private school in her home for {Swedish students. She said that the town used to be very elegant because there were many {private schools}and fine hotels then. An Indian prince once had a grand funeral procession here.{General {education}and{facilities}for ordinary children were better now she thought, although it was less crowded then and perhaps more friendly in her younger days.
